author: Harper Lee
description: Set in the Deep South, this Pulitzer Prize-winning novel explores issues of racism and injustice through the eyes of a young girl.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: This high fantasy novel follows a hobbit, a wizard, a dwarf, and a human as they embark on a perilous journey to destroy the One Ring.

author: George Orwell
description: This classic dystopian novel depicts a totalitarian future society where independent thought is discouraged and citizens are constantly surveilled.

author: Jane Austen
description: This classic romance novel follows the lives of the Bennett sisters as they navigate love, family, and social status in 19th-century England.

author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a post-apocalyptic future, this novel follows a young girl who volunteers to participate in a deadly game where contestants must fight to the death.

author: J.D. Salinger
description: This classic coming-of-age novel follows a disillusioned teenager as he navigates the challenges of adolescence and grapples with the idea of growing up.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Set in the roaring twenties, this novel explores themes of love, greed, and the American Dream through the eyes of a young man who becomes infatuated with his wealthy neighbor.

author: Margaret Atwood
description: In a totalitarian future society, this novel follows a handmaid who is forced into reproductive servitude and must find a way to escape.

author: Oscar Wilde
description: This classic novel explores the themes of vanity, morality, and the supernatural through the story of a young man who sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty.

author: Mark Twain
description: This classic American novel follows a young boy and a runaway slave as they travel down the Mississippi River and confront issues of racism and morality.

author: Alexandre Dumas
description: This classic adventure novel follows a man who seeks revenge against those who wronged him after he is imprisoned and later becomes wealthy.
This epic novel follows the lives of several families during the Napoleonic Wars and explores themes of love, family, and power.
